There were interview questions from the nurses as well which were like they were from textbooks.  I didn't really know the objectives of that. It look faked to me.

title: Nurse Extern II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: fairly easy, laid back once I got an interview. I had a few interviews through this company that I was stood up for. I tried at 3 different locations and only one manager showed up to a scheduled interview. the recruiter was very apologetic for the other managers.
Interview Questions: why did you choose this company, where do you see yourself within the next few years

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview with HR Representative over phone first. Then met supervisor for in person interview. Fairly standard questions, everyone was very pleasant and amicable. They both made me feel comfortable like I was having more of a conversation than being interviewed.
Interview Questions:
Tell me a little more about yourself.
Tell me about a time you faced conflict with a co-worker and how was it resolved?
If I asked some of your former co-workers how they would describe you, what would they say?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health (Park Ridge, IL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: A week after I applied I was contacted by a recruiter who screened me. As a former Advocate employee (PCA), my process was a bit different. After that call, we selected an interview date and time to meet with the unit manager. On my interview day, I met with the unit manager and she gave me a tour of the unit. I met with some of the nurses on the unit. A day later I received an offer.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Specialty Pharmacy Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health (Appleton, WI) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: After I had applied, a recruiter for this position decided to give me an unsolicited phone call at my current place of employment. This was both extremely embarrassing and awkward for me as I was trying to teach  a student and I was surrounded by other staff. During the phone call the recruiter told me the position was for a Long Term Care pharmacy supervisor. This make the position description totally inaccurate, since specialty pharmacy and long term care pharmacy are completely different. If the description was correct I would have never applied for this position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was informal and took about an hour. A tour was provided, and all staff greeted me on each floor. It seems like a great environment to work at.  It was more of a conversation rather than being interrogated with questions.
Interview Questions: what are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Rehab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health (Oak Park, IL) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was called by a recruiter and did a preliminary phone interview and that was the time where we set up a time to meet with the tech coordinator. After the first interview, the following week I came in for a peer interview with 2 techs and a PT.
Interview Questions: What kind of values would you bring to the team?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health (Milwaukee, WI) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed interview. Hiring manager very professional and easy to interview with. I felt all my questions were answered and it was a positive experience. I would say it was one of the best interviews I ever had.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you made a mistake and how was it handled?

title: FNP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the recruiter then received an email that they'd move forward with a face interview. After 2 weeks received an email from the recruiter with the job offer.
Interview Questions: Asked my previous experience. Why I want to work for Advocate

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health (Libertyville, IL) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Send resume, called in for interview, interview is 2 parts, one part with HR and another with a manager of the unit you applied for, then wait for a return call to see if you got the job
Interview Questions: What experience have you had in the past related to this position

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health (Kenosha, WI) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process. Phone interview with a recruiter, then with the hiring manager, shadowed on the floor, then was offered a position a week later. It is a long interview process though. It look about a month and a half.
Interview Questions: Explain a time you saw someone do something inappropriate and what did you do. Name three strengths and two weaknesses. Where do you see yourself in five years. Why nursing.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, Hr Called interviewed and scheduled a interview with the floor manager.  Was very nice and understood that you might be nervous . Asked questions that I found on here.
Interview Questions: Why Nursing?

title: Family Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Many phone interviews, and the first one caught me off guard as it was many months after I had originally applied.  It took to the fourth dialogue encounter (this one in person) to really dig into the depths of what the position details were - mainly because everyone I talked to prior didn't' have the answers. The in-person interview was scheduled for an hour - lasted over 90 minutes. While it went well, it was also a bit disjointed at times between the individuals interviewing me.
Interview Questions: Typical "name a time where you had to deal with a difficult provider".  Sometimes the dialogue was quite vague leading up to the question that wanted specifics, left little time to really process how to answer the questions.

title: HUC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health (Milwaukee, WI) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Fast at first but then slowed down one I started dealing with manager.  I was told I would get phone calls from manager by a certain date and didn't on multiple occasions.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with an employee you don't get a long with?

title: PSAR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health (Milwaukee, WI) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Quick.  Had a job within a few weeks.  However, I heard from others their interview process was a few months.  Applied online, then got an email asking to set up a phone screen.  Talked with a recruiter who then sent my information over to the manager who I had a group interview with.  After the interview I was shown the facility which I thought was a good sign.  I received a call the following week stating I had got the job.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself? Why do you want to work for Aurora?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health (Milwaukee, WI) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: After submitting several applications and several weeks, I had a phone interview for a position which I did not get. A few more applications and I received a call for an in person interview, which I thought went very well, was taken on a tour of the area, meet other employees, etc. everyone seemed so nice and interested in me. Week and a half later received an e-mail that they selected another candidate. Applied for more positions, website states I'm "being considered" Hopefully I'll receive a call and or offer for that position! It just seems to be taking a long time!
Interview Questions: What was your proudest moment as a Phlebotomist?

title: Senior Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health (Oak Brook, IL) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview with H.R.  Next on-site with hiring manager. Possibly a third if you got that far.
Two separate contacts stated they would notify of next steps. Was Ghosted after the first interview never heard from them again. Did receive an interview survey about how the company did, which seemed pretty rude and unprofessional considering they also "Ghosted" me on the interview process.
Interview Questions: Why Advocate? Tell me about yourself? What are your strengths and weaknesses. Have you done this technology or that technology?

title: Nutritional Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health (Barrington, IL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: first there was a phone screen with HR. Then they set up an interview with the department manager. Questions were behaviorally based, and personality based like strengths, weaknesses and then asking about long term goals.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you dealt with a difficult client.

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Fun company to work with great people great staff. One of the top hospitals I know of, I was interested from visiting a friend who was a patient there awhile back
Interview Questions: How  would you describe yourself

title: PSR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health (Milwaukee, WI) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: 1st will be an interview with HR then supervisor of department . Then it will take months to hear back if they have an offer or not. They process takes forever
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond.

title: Schedule Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health (Downers Grove, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty simple. Meet with the manager first and then I met with 3 members of the team all together.  The manager pretty much prepared me to meet with the team because I believed me liked me that much and wanted them to like me as well.  It was very nice of her to do that.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a difficult situation in your previous position?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Advocate Aurora Health (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: 1:1 with the manager, she asked me several questions on my interview. Familiarized me with all the clinics I would have to go to, introduced me to all the staff on the team.  Overall it was a great experience.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work for Advocate?
